SENT.plain: Given its catalytic activity to generate diacylglycerol and inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate, phospholipase C (PLC) is implicated in promoting cell growth
However, we found that PLC-beta3-deficient mice develop myeloproliferative disease, lymphoma, and other tumors
The mutant mice have increased numbers of hematopoietic stem cells with increased proliferative, survival, and myeloid-differentiative abilities
These properties are dependent on Stat5 and can be antagonized by the protein phosphatase SHP-1

Stat5-dependent cooperative transformation by active c-Myc and PLC-beta3 deficiency was suggested in mouse lymphomas in PLC-beta3(-/-) and in Emicro-myc;PLC-beta3(+/-) mice and human Burkitt's lymphoma cells
The same mechanism for malignant transformation seems to be operative in other human lymphoid and myeloid malignancies
Thus, PLC-beta3 is likely a tumor suppressor
